topic.shortdesc: Merges one or more incremental backups together.

section.title: Description
section.p: Merging incremental backups allows you to free up disk space on the machine where your backup archive is located by de-duplicating similar data between backups. It also allows you to run continuous incremental backups and avoid having to run full backups.

The merge command does not delete any files from the backup archive until it is finished merging all of the data together. Make sure there is a free disk space at least equal to the size of all incremental backups that are being merged.

section.title: Options
section.p:
The following are the command options:
merge options
Option Description
--dir /[directory name] Name of the backup directory.
--name REPOSITORY-NAME Name of the backup repository.
--start [backup timestamp] Timestamp of the first backup from which to merge.
--end [backup timestamp] Timestamp of the last backup through which to merge.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Run the merge command to merge backups together, starting and ending with the specified backup timestamps:./backup merge --dir /tmp/backups --name travel --start 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00 \ --end 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00
